bibl.title: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, March 17, 1942

div1.p: Kellogg sends Hench a letter from Hoffmann. He comments on the reliability of Hoffmann.

div1.head: Letter from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, March 17, 1942

opener.dateline:
GEORGE A. KELLOGG
257 CORNELISON AVENUE
JERSEY CITY, N.J.
March 17, 1942.

div1.p:
You may not be interested in reading
any more letters from Professor W. H. Hoffmann but
in case you might be I am enclosing a copy of the
most recent one.

I am not quite sure whether this man
is nuts or not. He might be an unheralded genius as
far as I know, another Finlay crying in the dark.

There is nothing more that I can do
for him and I don't see why he continues to write to
me such lengthy letters. At any rate, here is the
letter for what you can make out of it.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, George A. Kellogg Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester
Minnesota
